summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of North Forty-ninth Street, in the City of Seattle, from Interlake Avenue to Aurora Avenue, by attaching hydrants to the existing water mains therein, together with such gates, tees, connecting pipes and other appurtenances as may be necessary for the reasonable fire protection of said district, in accordance with Resolution No. 1062 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Immediate Payment," as provided by the laws of the State of Washington and the Charter and Ordinances of the City of Seattle
